resources.string: (n) opposition to the withdrawal of state support or recognition from an established church, especially the Anglican Church in 19th-century England.
(n) Rare. the estimation of something as valueless (encountered mainly as an example of one of the longest words in the English language).
(n) an obscure term ostensibly referring to a lung disease caused by silica dust, sometimes cited as one of the longest words in the English language.

(n) An inherited disorder that closely simulates the symptons but not the consequences of pseudohypoparathyroidism and, thus it has mild or no manifestations of hypoparathyroidism or tetanic convulsions.
(n) a technique for the separation and identification of mixtures of proteins, consisting of electrophoresis followed by immunodiffusion.
